author: Doris Bedford
content: Seller responded promptly to my request and answered my questions promptly. Easy to work with and would recommend

author: W. Horton
content: The product arrived promptly and was easy to set up. It is easy to operate and seems to work very well. The reason for my less than positive review is that the treadmill is simply not wide enough. I find it hard to walk for very long on it because my natural stride has my feet slightly farther apart and I cannot do that on this item since it is not wider. Disappointingly, I would not have purchased if I had realized it was not wider. Otherwise, it appears to be a very good product.

author: Lily Jones
content: I love the treadmill and no assembly required. There are two things I am not fond of: one is that it is shorter than I am used to, so I have to be careful not to walk off the back of the treadmill. I bought a wheel-free walker just to have something to hold onto while on the treadmill to stay standing straight and avoid moving too much, which was a solution for me. The other thing I don't like is that the speed only goes up to 2.5, which I should have checked before purchasing, but the speed I normally use is 2.6 or 2.7 for walking, so it's not a big issue. Overall, the treadmill works very smoothly, is very sturdy and well built, and I am still glad I purchased it even with the two cons.

author: KIM DEROSA
content: Love this !!! Great quality .. very little noise, and portable ! I have used this everyday since my husband bought it for me .

author: Thomas
content: Love my walking pad! Super easy way to get steps in during the day or during bad weather. Hate I didn‚Äôt buy one sooner! Highly recommend this brand!

author: AmazonFan
content: Great value-no complaints. As a writer who spends lots of time sitting this has been a very convenient way to get some exercise!.

author: Christopher Havens
content: This thing is crapping out after only 5 months of use. You get what you pay for.

author: Marla
content: ITS WELL PACKAGED. SO WELL, I NEEDED A COOKIE AND NAP AFTER I FINALLY GOT IT OUT OF THE WELL TAPED PACKAGING. SEEMS STURDY. HEAVIER THAN I THOUGHT IT WOULD BE. BIGGEST CON IS THE APP, ITS LIKE PLAYING A VIDEO GAME FULL OF ADS TO TRY TO TURN IT ON. I JUST WANT TO USE IT TO WALK, ADJUST THE SPEED. THATS IT. I HAVEN‚ÄôT DECIDED IF I‚ÄôM KEEPING IT, BECAUSE OF THE APP.

author: Andrea Johnson
content: I purchased this in July 2024. It‚Äôs worked great but now will not start and has a constant buzz when you turn the power on. Product support doesn‚Äôt answer their phone. I‚Äôd go with another brand unless you want something that dies less than a year later.

author: Chelsie Cole
content: Wonderful treadmill! It‚Äôs very easy to use and comes with detailed care instructions. The app is free and has tons of features you‚Äôd enjoy. I had to reach out to customer service support and they were friendly and helpful. I absolutely recommend this treadmill!

author: Lisarivera17
content: Good solid product. I purchased and I returned only because I decided to get the upgraded model with the bar. It is a small walking area and easily to step off the sides by accident.

author: Myriam
content: Wish there was a handle for better support and safety

author: Ted Jones Jr.
content: Instructions were a tad vague, but everything seemed common sense. Extra battery for remote which is nice. My wife and I are taller than average so the longer pad is nice.I‚Äôd recommend getting one with a cross bar or you‚Äôll tend to creep forward as you walk.

author: Angela
content: I works well for me to get my steps it. It states it will work for up to 300 lbs. However, for my partner who weighs around 230-240 it doesn‚Äôt work.

author: Lorelli
content: Just what I wanted! It‚Äôs compact, has wheels, and can be stored or left out. It‚Äôs a quiet walker and the versatility with settings works well. I like that it shows my time lapse, distance walked and speed. I purchased a pretty color just to make me a little happier when I got on to work out lol. Mine is mint green but it comes in other colors. It is a good value for the price.

author: cakequeen
content: If u don't have room for full size treadmill, this is a great option. Really well made and sturdy.

author: Our neck of the woods
content: The media could not be loaded. Did not work out of the box. Loud squealing sound. Belt not moving and screen blacked out. Received Superun (generic model) not Deerun. Many messages later with the seller, refund pending. Will update if I receive refund. Lots of reviews 1 and 2 star for same issue and worse. Wish I‚Äôd noticed before purchasing. Size is perfect but quality of this one was completely lacking. Assembly wasn‚Äôt required. Go with Deerun directly, they are what we have at work and they are great.

author: Dad_Rizz
content: Fast & Understanding Customer Service. Good value for money.

author: Kay Gee
content: I don‚Äôt have enough room here to say how much I love this tread mill. I used it at work every day. When I had an issue the company took care of the problem. Great product! Great customer service! I have been recommending it to all my co-workers!

author: Jesse
content: Nice walking pad, that functions well. It needs the option to mute the beeper since it requires you to desolder it off of the motherboard if you want it to be quiet. The remote also might sync with another pad if it is used in the same room. If you don't care about either of those, I would say go for it.

author: AmazonMMV
content: Great customer service. Walking pad is perfect size! Would buy again!

author: Hannah
content: DO NOT BUY. Where do I even begin? Within 5 minutes on this ‚Äúwalking‚Äù pad, it started throwing me off like a mechanical bull at a county fair. It went from ‚Äúgentle stroll in the park‚Äù to ‚Äútell my family I love them‚Äù in record time. Apparently, the belt has a mind of its own‚Äîsliding left, right, then left again‚Äîlike it‚Äôs auditioning for a terrible Broadway dance number.Adjusting the belt? Sure! Just grab an Allen wrench, twist some knobs, whisper a prayer, and you might as well do the Hokey Pokey because that‚Äôs about as successful as you‚Äôll get at straightening this contraption out. I spent more time fiddling with it than actually walking, and by the end, my heart rate was up only from frustration, not exercise. In the end, if you‚Äôd like to add some excitement to your home‚Äîperhaps by yelling at an inanimate object every morning‚Äîgo for it. Otherwise, save your money and avoid the emotional roller coaster this treadmill will inevitably bring.

author: connie
content: Plugged it in, would not work

author: Mara Marius
content: Was great in the beginning but only worked for 3 months and now I'm on a search for another one from a different brand

author: Brooke
content: I love this walking pad. It works great and easy to store. The customer service is responses within a day.

author: Banana phone
content: I love this treadmill. It is really nice to get exercise while working at my desk. Also, their customer service is very responsive with any questions.

author: Flamingo Walker
content: Easy to use and move around. Convenient size to store under a bed.Love that I can get my walk in when weather is not cooperative!

author: Bridget Simmons
content: Fits under my couch and easy to stow away. I‚Äôve been using it every day. It‚Äôs been great for staying active in the cold dark winter. I‚Äôm 5‚Äô4‚Äù and the length is fine for me. However it‚Äôs a little short for my husband who has a longer stride at 6‚Äô2‚Äù.

author: Carma
content: Pad is too small to truly take a brisk walk on , and I‚Äôm only 5‚Äô3‚Äù. Wasted my money.

author: K
content: I walked on this treadmill for five days a week for a whole month. I tried to get on it today. Which is the last day of the month and it says error. Do not buy this walking pad.

author: Marc Drown

author: Mikayla Ojeda

author: Baysmom
content: I am pleased with the walking pad. It is sturdy and easy to move and store under the bed. I really like that it goes to 5 mph. I did have to adjust the belt the first 3 or 4 times I used it, but after that, it pretty much stayed in place. The only thing I wish it had is a pause option, instead of having to restart the time and distance if having to stop.

author: Kimi

author: TiffMc
content: As a starter treadmill it really worked fine for the price. It was fairly quiet. It's easy to move out of the way.The walking pad is not very long. I'm tall and my feet often touch the front or back edge of the walking pad. I believe some of the photos are photoshopped to make it look longer than reality. In some of them the woman could take two full strides. In reality it's cramped for one, if you're tall.The beeper is REALLY LOUD. Very annoying. Why advertise how quiet the machine is and then put an unnecessarily loud noise maker on it?But overall, we definitely got our money's worth. And arrived several days quicker than expected!

author: EdGOhio
content: Overall a good walking track and packaged well. For myself this is good fit as I'm just under 5'9" so my gait isn't that long and don't intend to use for running, its' top speed is 3.8mph anyways. At 65+ this is for winter and harsh weather time to keep the ole joints "greased". If you have a long gait or a widespread walking habit you may run into the issue of being too short and narrow. This isn't a design defect just simply made for people with different needs. A set of related issues are: lack of a grab handle when trying to roll around to store away and extremely small roller wheels associated with that. Overall a good product for the price, will revisit after a few months. Stay healthy all!

author: Kindle Customer
content: Love the portability of it!

author: Amazon Customer
content: I would love this product if the walking pad were wider for larger people.

author: Shari DeSmet
content: The media could not be loaded. Product is perfect for home or office. Does what it's supposed. Great for the person who does a lot of work at a desk, start it up, get on the pad and walk for a few minutes gets the blood and joints moving.Thanks DeerRun.

author: Queen Verne
content: As described

author: AB
content: The media could not be loaded. I bought 2 different brands and this is the better of the 2. It seems a lot studier and runs quieter than the Lichico brand I purchased. The only issue with this one is it beeped too loud when turning on and adjusting speeds. This beep was loud enough to be heard the floor below me and in the offices on my floor. I was able to take it apart easily and fill in/cover the speaker (circled in red) with Hot Glue. I chose hot glue since it was already present in other places. It is now the perfect walking pad. It runs very quietly and the beeping sound is now minimal. I most likely voided my warranty doing this but I am happy. If they make a 2025 model I would suggest a quieter speaker.

author: Amazon Customer
content: The belt slides constantly to one side. I have to adjust every time sometimes multiple times when using.

author: christina
content: The belt always shifts no matter how many times I adjust it. It also gets hot after being on it for 30 minutes

author: michele
content: My unit didn‚Äôt turn on out of the box. No help from customer support number.

author: Berta
content: I particularly like DeerRun's rewards program, which allows me to get extra rewards and discounts by participating in various challenges and achieving goals. This not only increases the fun of exercise, but also gives me more motivation to stick to it. Overall, this smart walking board is an ideal choice for office fitness.

author: Norman Johnson
content: This DeerRun 2024 Upgraded Smart Walking Board is a great choice for me to stay healthy in the office. The installation process is very simple and can be completed in just a few minutes. Using the APP/remote control function, I can start or stop the treadmill anytime and anywhere, adjust the speed and incline. In addition, this treadmill is equipped with a clear LED display that can display my exercise data in real time, including speed, time, distance, and calorie consumption.

author: Mark a Kelly
content: This DeerRun 2024 Upgraded Walking Board is awesome! Its smart features and rewards program keep people motivated while exercising. The installation process is also very quick and easy, with almost no tools required. The treadmill's 2.5HP motor provides plenty of power and keeps things running smoothly even at high speeds. The app and remote control features allow me to easily adjust settings, while the LED display clearly shows my progress and calories burned. This treadmill fits perfectly under my desk, allowing me to stay fit while working.

author: Lisa A.
content: I like this so much I bought 2 of them so I wouldn't have to share with the rest of the family. I don't have room for a regular treadmill but this stores easily under a bed or leaning up against a wall.

author: Christie Brown
content: The DeerRun walking pad has an electrical issue that throws household breakers when turned on. Very disappointed and returning item.

author: Anthony Oswald
content: Not ten minutes after getting it the power button stuck and would not work. Called the number and after several emails that went no where I gave up!!! Don't order save your money...

author: Sherry Boyett
content: Great for when weather is nasty. Could have been longer.

author: Tani Newton
content: This thing works great ! I love everything about it but wish I had gotten one with arms. It‚Äôs quiet. It‚Äôs got power but sometimes I get a little dizzy looking down at it all the time. So when I look up I get a little off kilter. Lol ! It‚Äôs def worth the money. But spend a little more and get the arms with it !

author: Miranda
content: I would recommend this pad to anyone thinking about getting one. I really like how easy it is to use. An inexpensive (no gym fees) yet very effective way to get my walking in on days I don't feel like braving hot or cold weather outside. It's fun to use and know I'm taking care of myself!

author: javier tapia
content: I bought this as a gift for my wife and she has absolutely loved it. She uses it just about every day, it‚Äôs been consistent and is easy to set up.

author: Ramona M.
content: Well I ordered two of these, the first one I ordered , was delivered in a timely manner, I liked it so much that I purchased a second one for my Son's household as a Christmas gift. The second one was very disappointing. Everytime they try to use it, it trips the breaker, no matter where they plug it in. I am now trying to contact the seller, ... To be continued... update, extending my apologies to the company and anyone that my negative comments lead a stray.After I contacted the seller and informed them of what I thought was a defective product, the seller reached out to me and shipped a new walking pad immediately to correct the situation. After troubleshooting by taking the walking pad to a different house, it worked perfectly, no issues.The problem appears to be with house hold electrical system. I am very satisfied with Both walking pads . Definitely recommending.

author: JohnInHoustonTexas
content: I am very pleased with the GRAY SupeRun walking pad that was sent to me, even though I ordered a BLACK Deer Run. (Seems to be the same thing with the same specs.)Not sure how I ended up with a different color from a different brand.It was easy to put together, and was well packaged. Not a scratch or dent on the machine from shipping.I'm deducting a star for the impossibly difficult sticker at the top of the walking pad. Most of the time for items like this the adhesive will lift off with ease. This decal was the opposite. It left a trail of thick goo all over the top of the machine and it took about 45 minutes of scrubbing with Spray and Wash and 91% rubbing alcohol to get all of adhesive removed .üôÑI do a lot of walking so if this treadmill does not hold up I will update my review.

author: Rachel
content: Pros: works right out of the box. I've walked on it for 3 sessions of 30-45 minutes between 2 and 3.5 mph with almost no issues (230lb 5'10"). It had no problem keeping up the pace, and generally the belt did not slip (see below for the exception). It is easy to move, and it connects with the app easily. The remote works.Walking experience: The walking surface is less shock-absorbent than a "real" treadmill, but still passable. Know that even the larger "plus" model is much smaller than your average treadmill. If you are tall like me, it takes some practice to be able to walk without scraping the front of the cover while also not letting your feet off the end. For me, it's exactly big enough to walk normally with zero extra space. I would have liked an extra inch or two on the sides and in the length so that I didn't have to train myself to stay in the exact ideal spot.On belt slipping: The belt assembly comes mostly balanced -- I noticed some minor drift at first, but nothing major. But I have a, perhaps unwise, habit of stepping off of treadmills at low speed or during their cooldown phase by letting the belt pull me off the end and landing on one foot. I did it on this one, and the belt became horribly unbalanced, slid all the way to one side, and ground a small divot into the plastic of the side rail before I could get it to stop. It took about 20 minutes of careful adjustment with the included allen key to get it to run normally again. This is likely user error, but be aware that the belt assembly is more delicate than your average, more durable treadmill, as I've never had this issue on "real" treadmills. I would recommend always using its ramp-up and ramp-down functions instead of jumping on or off at speed to avoid this. There are good tutorials online for tightening and balancing a treadmill belt.Safety concern: The manual mentions a magnetic safety key, but my model does not seem to have one, and runs normally without any kind of key. As I don't plan on going higher than 3.5mph, and as it is very close to the ground, this does not concern me a ton, but it is something to consider. There do not appear to be any other safety features, other than the physical guards and warning labels.App: I haven't used it aside from testing the direct treadmill control functions. It did connect easily to the treadmill via bluetooth/wifi, and the controls from your phone do seem to work, which is great to have in case I lose the remote. The little virtual running game does seem functional, though I'm not particularly interested in the social media or monetization aspect of it.

author: grandma of 15
content: Like how easy it rolls around the house, you can walk run while using your arms for extra cardio, easy to read how many miles and the speed you're going. I am 5" 4" 1/2 67 years old, weigh 160 Lbs. Love how it's marked with yellow stickers on each side to keep your feet where they should be so not to worry about falling off the end. The price is great!

author: Dawn Hunsberger
content: This is a fantastic product to finish getting your steps while watching your favorite show. It‚Äôs easy to pick up and move to another part of the house. Use of the product is self explanatory which is great. You can definitely get your heart rate up on it, although I haven‚Äôt tried anything faster than a brisk walk. Don‚Äôt take the calorie burn numbers seriously as they are much higher than actual calorie burn but otherwise it‚Äôs a great product.

author: Grace Rodriguez
content: I have used this product for three days. It was a heavy lift up three flights of stairs but it was worth it. The machine works well from the slowest to highest speed. The only qualm I have is that the remote sometimes doesn't work and you need to turn on and off the machine.

author: efm
content: This is a great walking pad that goes fast enough to get me moving, but not so fast that it isn't safe without hand rails. The customer service has been great, too, and supported me when my remote to the pad needed to be replaced.

author: jacque
content: Love it

author: Pat
content: Hard to keep balance without something to hold onto

author: Jeramy
content: I got this for my wife‚Äôs early Christmas present and she uses it everyday and loves it

author: Honest Review
content: I received this item about a week before the scheduled delivery so that was a pleasant surprise. I tested it out last night and used it again this morning after my workout at the gym and I have to say I‚Äôm super happy with this purchase. It arrived just in time as the weather has changed and it‚Äôs too cold to do my normal walk through the neighborhood in the morning. If there‚Äôs any changes I will come back to update my review but for now I‚Äôm very happy with my purchase!!

author: Bonita
content: i really love this. its a bit heavy to move around, it does not fit under my sofa so i leans it up against a wall when not using. i like the convience of not having to go outside in bad weather and i can still get in a bit of exercise. it comes completely assembled, just plug it in. i thought i would feel a bit disoriented without bars to hold onto, but i just walk slowly, at a pace i would normally walk. i like it a lot, wish i wouldve thought of this sooner i would be down a few pounds by now.

author: CL
content: I purchased my treadmill and used for a few months. I got an error code. I reached out to Customer Service. They responded back within a day. In the end, they replaced my treadmill. They were very helpful and corresponded throughout the replacement process.I use my treadmill everyday. It is quiet and easy to use. I am happy with my purchase and Customer Service.I would like to see them improve on the time feature. If you stop for a couple of minutes, the clock restarts.Definitely a great buy for the money.

author: Myra Hicks
content: It‚Äôs perfect to have in the corner of the office. When turned on it beeps loud and the motor is just a soft hum, not loud at all. When you walk on it is when it‚Äôs a bit louder (just from the belt rubbing against the tread as you step) and could bother other people around if you work in a space with others. I keep mine in an empty space currently with the door closed and no one can hear me walking on it only the beeps when you turn it off. Easy to use too. You only need to plug it in, flip the on/off switch in the front. It comes with a remote that I think it‚Äôs really neat and an extra battery. It also comes with a bolt tightening tool and lubricant for the belt. It‚Äôs built sturdy and has wheels. I really like it and it‚Äôs not too big, it‚Äôs a decent size if you don‚Äôt have a wide walk. So for most men it might be a bit narrow. So far it functions nicely and I believe it‚Äôll last a while.

author: Natasha Noire
content: Latest update: It‚Äôs back to working. Not sure why the tool wasn‚Äôt working for me before but it is now. I haven‚Äôt had to adjust the belt quite as often. Maybe I‚Äôve lost a few pounds (not from the device) so it stopped sliding as much without the pressure.Edited again: Back to the belt sliding and this time, the tool to adjust it isn‚Äôt working. It doesn‚Äôt turn enough to adjust it. I‚Äôll keep you updated.Edited review: I used this walking pad 4 times before the belt slipped. They send a tool to align it. It took some work around to get it right but the Universe delivered because now it‚Äôs where I need it to be. It‚Äôs still not as stable as I would like but it works well enough to get the job done. Good value for the money I spent.I do wish the remote control had a pause button but maybe I missed that somewhere. Because I have to stop it every time, it starts the count over, but maybe the app fixes that. I didn‚Äôt download it. I like that the remote has a handle to keep around the wrist. Easy to use. I love that I didn‚Äôt have to put anything together. It was ready to use straight out the box.

author: Katharine
content: I took the item out of the box, followed the instructions, and now the belt won‚Äôt stay in line properly. So I readjusted it as the instructions say, and the belt has shifted completely over and got stuck under the plastic. I got to use it all of 15 mins, before it has become unfixable.

author: Jules
content: This has worked great so far! I have this in my carpeted office and I put it on a yoga mat so it can easily slide under the daybed in the room. It‚Äôs heavy, but it‚Äôs been easier to slide under the bed vs rolling it. The only problem I have with it is you have to concentrate while walking on it and your foot placement or else you can accidentally step off of it - which I have done numerous times ü§£. I have a treadmill with the bar, but it‚Äôs older and too noisy and I don‚Äôt have enough room for it. This one is quiet and easily hidden while not in use!

author: Rebekah
content: Easy to use, easy to move.

author: BUM G Family
content: Get great workouts anywhere in the house with this walking pad. It‚Äôs quiet. You can work,run,walk,or dance walk as I love doing. Elevated the daily movement goals. Lightweight, easy to move around.

author: Amazon Customer
content: I bought this about 3 months ago and I love it! I use it every working day at the beginning of my work day and have easily put 100 miles on it already. It is easy to adjust and move around. Two recommendations for the manufacturer would be to make the time/distance a stored memory function, especially when pausing (it just starts you over at 0 time/0 miles) and to allow the user to turn off the sound on start up. I do use this on the second floor of my house, and no complaints on the sound of the treadmill itself during use.

author: DKL81
content: There are a million of these low price walking treadmills online. They all look basically the same to me. I assumed they‚Äôre all cheaply made. But rolled dice on this one. And it‚Äôs great. Higher quality, more solid/heavy, quiet, etc. than I expected.

author: KBarnes
content: It‚Äôs very quiet and works well. If I had anything negative to say-it would be that it would be nice to have it a little wider. I have to really pay attention to what I‚Äôm doing. I got sucked into a tv show and actually fell/stepped off of it lol But for the price and all the other features-it‚Äôs a great machine and would buy it again.

author: Jennifer Trimbee
content: Really impressed with the quality for the price, but I‚Äôve only had it for a few hours. Will update when I have a better idea about it‚Äôs durability, but I am very happy for far.

author: Sue
content: It‚Äôs quiet and easy to move to different places in my room. I like the slightly longer one.

author: Ira Cornell Taylor
content: I didn‚Äôt want a large piece of equipment, just something to help me stay active, and this walking pad is exactly what I needed! It rolls under the bed easily when we have company, but I use it in the living room while I‚Äôm cooking. It has all the features I need without being overwhelming. So glad I decided to buy this!

author: Toni
content: One thing I wish I noticed before purchasing: It doesn‚Äôt incline!If I had known, I probably would have picked a different model, but despite that, I still use and love it.P R I C E / V A L U EThe price makes it worth tolerating some of the negative issues I mention below like the sound, lack of incline, and the stats resetting.S P E E DI typically walk at 2.8 mph or lower, so the max speed isn‚Äôt an issue for me. It‚Äôs perfect for casual walking while working or watching TV.L E N G T HAt 5‚Äô2‚Äù, the length of the walking pad is just right for me, but my 6‚Äô2‚Äù friend said it feels a bit short for his stride. So, if you‚Äôre taller, this could be something to consider.Q U A L I T YThe walking pad feels sturdy overall, and I appreciate that it was ready to use right out of the box‚Äîno assembly required. However, sometimes it glitches if I press the start button too quickly, and I have to restart it.A C C E S S I B I L I T YMoving it around is a bit of a hassle. While it‚Äôs not overly difficult, I frequently switch between walking and sitting while working, and I wish there was an easier way to move it. Also, I don‚Äôt have a convenient place to hide it, so it stays out in the open when not in use.S A F E T YThere‚Äôs no emergency stop feature, and the sides of the pad are small, so if I need to take a quick break, I either have to jump off or turn it off completely, which can be inconvenient.S T A T SEDIT: to Pause this machine you have to HOLD the pause button and it keeps your stats![Another annoying thing is that the stats reset when you hit pause, so your time and distance disappear. It would be nice to pause it for a quick break and pick up where I left off. But it‚Äôs not a dealbreaker.]S O U N DIt‚Äôs loud when you turn it on, and the beeping every time you increase or decrease the speed is pretty annoying. I hate the startup sound, but it‚Äôs not horrible‚Äîjust one of those things you put up with.T A K E A W A YBecause of the price, I tolerate the negatives. I honestly love how easy it is to get my steps in, especially living in Arizona, where it‚Äôs too hot to walk outside most of the year.Would I buy it again? Maybe. Probably not this exact model, as I would prefer one with an incline, but that‚Äôs on me for not noticing that part. When I was shopping for a walking pad, it was overwhelming, and there were a lot of options available. My main concern was how it would feel while walking on it, and it‚Äôs sturdy so overall I‚Äôm happy with my purchase.

author: Phill
content: we got it for 2 weeks.Pros: price is affordable. easy to move around. small but good enough for easy walk. easy to assemble.Cons: it's not so loud with acceptable noise volume. However, it could be better for the noise control. the belt has been off track several times and I have to adjust it. the plastic is kind of cheap and fragile making it easily break apart.talked to the customer services and they are nice and quick to solve the problem.

author: Natalya Shcherbak
content: Poor quality, no good

author: Jewille Smith
content: It's quite narrow so I lost my balance on it and almost fell several times. There are two metal pieces at the end on both sides that almost injured my feet each time I used it. The only things I like about it is the display and remote control.

author: Sandy Armstrong
content: It didn‚Äôt have the bars with it

author: ghada
content: It‚Äôs for my son he‚Äôs using it every day I guess he‚Äôs enjoying using it

author: Yara

author: Em

I searched ‚Äúyagud walking pad setup‚Äù and easily found several people‚Äôs videos reviewing the walking pad. It‚Äôs heavier than I thought it would be, not flimsy or cheap feeling. I am over 200 pounds and it holds me just fine. It‚Äôs super quiet and easily stores under my couch. Overall very happy with this!

author: Siestagirl
content: 4 stars! Short power cord and some grumbling feeling when I walk on it but its relatively quiet. It takes a lot of balance so keep a chair next to you if needed. Dont be looking at your phone while walking on it or you will fall. I easily walked 30 min, got my rhythm ok. I plan to use it up to an hour daily while watching tv to lose 10lbs or so. Glad I bought it. Remote comes with battery in it plus a spare. Box was heavier than I thought but I was able to lift it. Use a utility knife to cut the tape marks on box and styrofoam. Plug it in, turn red button on in back. Turn remote on. I am only walking at 2.4 mph at first but it goes to 3.8 mph.

author: Avid Hiker
content: Came cracked out of the box, though I suspect this was more of a delivery issue. It's got some weight to it (at least 30lb?) but still portable. The power chord is rather short 2.5ft, so a grounded extension cord is needed. Will use this during my zoom meeting for the next 2hr and provide further updates with more use down the line.

author: Lisette
content: Product came with the belt shifted all the way to the left, soon as I powered on it started tearing at the side of the belt. Now I finally got it centered but it will not move with me on it. Very frustrating and a total waste of money.

author: Nykaba
content: I recieved this item and a piece had broken off of it in the box. It did not effect how it worked but I feel like for the price, I should recieve an item that it not broken. Unfortunately, I reordered it and it came broken again! It looks like I was given one that was repackaged after a return. Save the headache and buy a different brand.

author: Occam's Razor
content: I got one of these under 100 bucks, it's works great, 20 minutes can walk 2 1/2 football fields in distance. I actually slide it in between the legs of my workout tower, it fits perfectly...

author: CC
content: The media could not be loaded. I‚Äôm pretty happy with this walking pad. Since starting a sedentary job and starting to have kids, I‚Äôve gained a lot of weight and I just don‚Äôt have the energy to do anything. I work from home 3 days a week and bought a standing desk to help reduce my sedentary job, but it didn‚Äôt seem to do much. I got this walking pad and have been using it for a few months and while I haven‚Äôt lost much weight, I feel better and I can tell it‚Äôs made a difference. I‚Äôm able to walk about 5 miles during the day while I‚Äôm working. This is a huge increase from the zero I was doing before.On to the specific pad. This pad seems to be quieter than the few I‚Äôve seen. I‚Äôm about 225 pounds and a couple others I tried out were pretty loud every time you stepped on it. The plastic pieces would creak and kind of grind and this one doesn‚Äôt do that. The motor itself is fairly quiet, but on par with others I tried. Its not quiet enough to do while on the phone h less you had a really effective noise canceling headset.The instructions are pretty clear and it comes with a bottle of oil to lubricate it. It also tells you how to adjust the pad if it slides off at all. My floor is actually slightly slanted (120 yr old house) and the belt does get slightly off because of this. It‚Äôs super easy to fix.I‚Äôve seen some of these where they fold or roll out of the way easily and this doesn‚Äôt do that, but I never expected it to.It has both count down and count up features, which is. Ice. The remote it comes with works perfectly and I haven‚Äôt had any problems with it. The pad only goes to 3.8 which I‚Äôm guessing was determined to be the fastest speed while still being safe. I wish if went a hair faster, but I‚Äôd rarely use it that fast, so it‚Äôs not a big deal.It fits perfectly under my desk and I‚Äôm thrilled to be able to use it while I work.
wished_features: remote, wheels, foldability, quiet, LED lighting, desk compatibility

author: Joe Peepos
content: Great treadmill and great price. Worth full 5 stars for the following:Purchased 3/21/25 for delivery on 3/26, but delivered 3/22.Took longer getting out of box than setting up for first time use.Instructions are clear and simple.Works great.You can stop looking.

author: DJ Houston
content: I bought this walking pad a few months ago and it works fine. However, after using it regularly for a month or so, it started making loud creaking sounds, like it‚Äôs about to fall apart. Doesn‚Äôt seem to be made very well and I‚Äôm anticipating having to buy a new one soon.

author: Melanie
content: It‚Äôs good however the oil ruptured during the shopping. So now I have no oil.

author: Jules
content: Awesome for helping me meet step goal every day

author: cathye
content: I bought this walking pad to extend cardiac rehab (slow and steady) at home after suffering a heart attack during winter. I researched several before buying this one. The quality is very good. It counts up before starting and counts down before stopping, it has a pause feature and also uses a remote. I like that it fits under my bed when not being used and I personally do not have trouble storing it although it may be harder for an elderly person. Overall, I‚Äôm really impressed with this item and would buy it again.

author: James Richters
content: I have been completely overwhelmed with a gigantic project for the last 3 years. It's an extremely complex project that requires me to be on my computer all day every day for long hours, 7 days a week. Needless to say, I've put on more pounds that I would have liked... it just doesn't help that the only walking I was doing was to walk to the refrigerator and back to my desk. I got a sit to stand desk so at least I could get out of the chair and stand for a while, and that did help a lot, but I still just found it nearly impossible to take the time out to go for a real walk... so I got this, specifically so I could walk while working on my project. I find that under my desk in standing position, it works pretty well, I would not recommend it just in the middle of a room without a desk, because you have nothing to hold onto for balance... this is really only meant to be under a standing desk because it has no handrails. It is easy to put in place and to roll away to a corner when I need to sit for a while. I use it as much as I can, but to be honest, it's difficult to work on certain aspects of my project while walking, it's not the device, it's just a matter of being able to operate my computer while walking... I cannot type hardly at all while walking, and for my CAD designs and solid models, they require precision mouse usage, and even though I have a professional trackball that is very precise, if I am walking, it's hard to make it track correctly. There are some tasks I can do while walking, like checking emails, searching for and purchasing supplies and materials on Amazon, or generating invoices for customers... stuff that doesn't take any extensive typing or precision mouse movements... so I do get some use out of it... and it actually keeps me on task a little better because if I set up this treadmill, then I want to get all those things done while it's set up, because I know once I go back to the more critical tasks, I won't be able to use it... so it prevents me from flip-flopping between tasks as I need to set it up and put it away.

author: Richie Perry
content: So i got this around august of 2024. I use mine pretty heavily, almost daily for an hour. Here I am 6 months later and I think the pad is failing me. I have maintained it pretty well, but have probably hit 280+ miles on it, and I think the motor is now faulty.Doesn‚Äôt look like they have customer service or technicians readily available in NYC, but I can‚Äôt complain too much.

author: Sue S
content: This product is not working. The belt keeps slipping to the right or left and needs to constantly be readjusted. I tried to reach out to the company there is a phone number that is not operable and the option to message is also not working. I certainly wasted money on this one. It's a good thing it's no longer available

author: zach sodano
content: the size of this walking pad is a little small for me. i have a size 11 foot so its kinda big and after a few steps i almost fall off the thing. the remote seems a little cheap. it was very easy to set up but im looking for one that is a little bit more heavy duty. the belt seems ok but it moves alot when you are walking. overall its ok but i would say look for a more durable bigger one

author: joyce riley

I started checking them out on Amazon. I decided on this one because it had features I liked such as time, distance, calories and speed and they were all remotely controlled.Set up was a breeze Out of the box and ready to use. It is in my office. I also purchased a raised desk to go with it! This allows me to work and exercise daily without excuses!

author: Amazon Customer

author: Amazon Customer
content: Been using this walking pad for over a month now. It‚Äôs easy to use and I like that I can slide it back under my bed when I am done using it. Space saving and gets the job done of walking no matter what the weather is like outside. Great value for the price!

But overall it is good for small spaces

author: sue pulter
content: I love this walking pad. It is so convent in size as it fits under my bed perfectly and all you have to do is plug it in, hit the switch, and click the remote. Easy way to get my steps in while watching TV at home. 10/10 recommend

author: Lamont
content: I got this because here it gets amazingly hot outside during the Summer and there is no way I will be exercising in that heat. I find that it it too long to fit under my desk, so it is off to the side against a wall. I find it easy to use with the remote, though that did take some getting used to. It works fine, mine is a little noisy, but that's to be expected.The only real negative that people should look out for is the fact that it is a walking pad, so it doesn't have a console upfront for you to lean on, or grab if you lose your balance. I would definitely think twice about getting this if you have balance issues or anything of that nature. If not, this is a good way to get your steps in at home.

author: Taylor Barron

author: Cliente Kindle
content: I‚Äôve been using the YAGUD Under Desk Treadmill for a few weeks now, and it has completely changed my work-from-home routine. It‚Äôs compact, quiet, and easy to use. The speed range is perfect for walking while working, and when I need a quick jog, it performs smoothly. The running belt feels sturdy and provides good cushioning, so my knees don‚Äôt hurt after long walks. Plus, the remote control makes adjusting the speed effortless. If you‚Äôre looking for a reliable walking pad to stay active while working, this is a great choice!
wished_features: remote, foldability, quiet, shock absorption, desk compatibility

author: L Cofield Kramm
content: I love My new walking pad! I‚Äôve had many treadmills and I honestly do use them but I love that this doesn‚Äôt take up nearly the amount of space but does the exact same thing. Because it‚Äôs not huge I can also tuck it away & pull out in front of the tv easily!

author: highlandmck
content: BEWARE the belt is only 15 inches wide!!! The photo they show is completely deceptive - it looks huge - the woman in the photo must have been photoshopped in. The ad claims it's 19 inches wide but they're counting the width of the entire unit! I was doing sort of ok in bare feet or socks only, able to stay on -- but when I put sneakers on I was immediately thrown to the side twice in a row when my shoe went slightly off the belt. Thrown aside again on a third try before giving up. I was even using trekking poles for balance. It's a dangerous fall risk especially for an older person or weaker person who cannot risk a fall! And I can't walk or jog without wearing shoes due to needing arch support, it becomes very painful so I am going to need to return this.

author: Earnisha Ware
content: This item works great!! It's very easy to turn on and the remote control is great to get the right speed you want. I use it everyday in the comfort of my home and I'm getting in shape doing it. I would say get this now it's definitely worth the money.

author: Marvel House
content: What a pile of crap. Rearranged my entire room to have a place to put this and it does nothing at all! Now the box is ruined and I have to find a way to ship it back?! What a waste of money and so much time! Don't buy this junk!

author: AngelaB
content: Don‚Äôt waste your money. This thing worked TWICE in the three days I‚Äôve had it. I tried pairing the remote as instructed in the manual. Did not work. Swapped the battery. That worked. Used it, shut it off. Tried using it the second day, nothing. Paired the remote yet again. Nothing. Swapped the battery back to the original one, that worked. Third day nothing worked. It powers on but the belt will not move. Attempted yet again to pair the remote, which you should never have to do more than once. Shocker, it did not work. Swapped the batteries multiple times. Still nothing. Nothing works on the remote. Buy something that is NOT run by a remote. Cheap piece of crap. If I could give it zero stars I would. I relied on other reviews before making my purchase too. I asked for a replacement. They said it would take 2.5 weeks to arrive. Crazy, considering my original purchase arrived in two days. I opted for a full refund. Just not worth the hassle. Buy a different brand, something made in the USA.

author: Adyson
content: We love this walking pad! Very sturdy, smooth walk and quiet! Super pleased

author: Pennie Burke
content: Sturdy, and works well. Remote is easy to use. Good item for the price.

author: Cameron

author: Jennifer
content: I debated buying a walking pad for months. I finally bought this walking pad and I could not be happier. Well built and super quiet. It is also easy to move around. I have been using it while I work from home at a standing desk for about an hour each day. I wasn‚Äôt sure if I could work and walk at the same time, so I was surprised to find it actually helps me stay focused during conference calls. I‚Äôve even learned that I can type and walk! Love that this allows me to get in more steps during the day, although my watch doesn‚Äôt pick up on the steps. So, I track the time I spend ‚Äúindoor walking‚Äù as exercise on my watch.

author: Voidvz

I weigh over 250lbs and it holds me just fine. So just in case you were wondering!!! It's so easy to take out and store away. I can easily slide it from under my bed because of how light weight it is and easily slide it right back under . It's so compact it just fits right under no problem. Very easy to use. 10 out of 10 I would recommend!!
